root.name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Island Thunder
root.description: PlotThe year is 2010, and major changes are afoot in Cuba. Fidel Castro's heirs were unable to keep the revolutionary flame burning, and a surprise uprising has toppled the Communist regime. In it's wake, a fragile hope for democracy emerges. The interim President, Pedro Ebana, promises free elections, and requests international aide to safeguard said elections. For there are those in Cuba who still do not want a democratic regime, and they will do anything it takes - subversion, violence or open revolution - to make certain that Cuba's future is one that they will make for themselves.From the midst of chaos, comes the call for the Ghosts. Their mission: to ensure the integrity of the new Democratic Cuban elections and to thwart any attempts made to subvert them. As a violent revolution funded with drug money brews in the Western Provinces, it becomes clear that this will be the most dangerous mission the Ghosts have ever faced.OverviewTom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Island Thunder is an expansion for the original Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon. It consists of an all new single player campaign as well as a plethura of new multiplayer maps and modes.New additions include:5 new multiplayer maps3 new multiplayer modes including Cat and Mouse, Behemoth, and Defend8 mission single-player campaign set in Cuba12 new weapons including the SR-25 Silenced Sniper Rifle and the MM-1 Grenade LauncherAn improved AAR (After-Action Review) Improved binocularsCinematic insertion and extraction sequencesAs in the original Ghost Recon, completing secondary objectives will reward you with all new specialist characters. Some objectives will be time-based while others will include rescuing civilians, capturing hostile leaders, and blowing up enemy ammunition and weapon stockpiles.WeaponsThere are a number of new weapons available in Island Thunder. Some will appear in the hands of unlocked Specialist characters while others may only be available in Multiplayer or Quick Mission modes.New weapons include:Rifleman KitsM4 SOCOMvz. 58Support KitsRussian 7.62mm DPRP-46M240GDemolitions KitsZ-84MM-1 Grenade LauncherSA 25Sniper KitsSR-25 (Silenced and Non-Silenced Versions)Pistol Kits9mm SA PistolRussian 9mm PistolAdditional KitsRifleman now have access to the AK-74 and the AK-47 Assault Rifles in multiplayer and quick mission modes.Emplaced WeaponsThe AGS-17 Automatic Grenade Launcher system can now be found in multiple missions. It functions much like the emplaced .50 Calibre Machine Gun.Minimum Requirements (PC)CPU: Pentium 2 with 450MHz or equivalentMemory: 128MB of RAMOperation System: Windows 9X/ME/2000/XPDirectX: DirectX 8.0 or higher (Included with Retail Version)Video Card: 16MB DirectX 8 compatible 3D CardHard Drive Space: 500MB MinimumCD-ROM: 4X or betterAudio: DirectX 8.0 or compatibleSound Card: DirectX 8.0 or compatibleInternet/Network Play: TCP/IP Internet or LAN ConnectionOriginal Ghost Recon is Required
